pr_title: Functional tests for new Search page

timeline.message:
Give Search result list an ID so that the autotest can access
the list conveniently.
Add a autotest PageObject for the new Search page.

Add a Selenium test for the new Search page

1. Create two methods to help access the list of Search
result items and the link of a specified item.

2. Create a test case to check if the initial search is
completed after open the page. This method is also annotated
by 'BeforeMethod'.

3. Create a test case to check if clicking an item will
open this item's summary page.
Add more methods interacting with the Search page.
Add more test cases for new Search page.
Include the new test suite in CI.
Merge branch 'component/new-search-page' into feature/autotests-for-search-page
Add the AutoTest account to Institution Facet.
Update the search settings of Institution Facet.
Update the ACLs of Institution Facet.
Update NewSearchPageTest to run against Institution Facet.
Add testing items to Institution Facet.
No longer need the ID of searchResultList so remove it.

timeline.bodyText: Curious.... You say the initial search should return 10 items, but then you wait for 16...
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: oops I forgot to update the comment.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.bodyText: It'd be good to have this as a method of NewSearchPage. Maybe with a signature of: SummaryPage selectItem(String itemTitle).
timeline.author: edalex-ian
edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText:
I was wondering why you were going through this pain when you actually don't need anything else AbstractCleanupAutoTest really provides - other than perhaps the prepareBrowserSession implementation. So on digging deeper I think it would be good to:

Move com.tle.webtests.test.AbstractCleanupTest#logon, com.tle.webtests.test.AbstractCleanupTest#AUTOTEST_LOGON and com.tle.webtests.test.AbstractCleanupTest#AUTOTEST_PASSWD to com.tle.webtests.test.AbstractSessionTest
Make this test then simply extend com.tle.webtests.test.AbstractSessionTest
And in this test add your implementation of prepareBrowserSession which simply calls the newly located com.tle.webtests.test.AbstractSessionTest#logon
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText:
Seeing this is all about testing the new stuff, should we perhaps move it (and the below Page class) over to the io.github.openequella package tree? Maybe they could be:

io.github.openequella.search.NewSearchPageTest
io.github.openequella.pages.search.NewSearchPage
timeline.author: edalex-ian
edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: It was actually used. The test expects no items found if today is selected, but this failed because of the two new items. So I removed it. Now I can call this method again. The test will select Today and check, and then select All and check.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if instead we should use the @FindById and a class property. 🤔
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: I think it's good to use this annotation for three components: the search bar, new search button and the refine panel show more button.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.message: Update NewSearchPageTest comments.

Add a method in NewSearchPage to abstract out
the user action of selecting an item.

Clean up the autotest class tree.

1. Move the method for logon as Autotest and two constants
from AbstractCleanupTest to AbstractSessionTest.
2. Make NewSearchPageTest extend AbstractSessionTest and
override method 'prepareBrowserSession' for logon.

Move NewSearchPage and NewSearchPageTest to package
'io.github.openequella'.

Check whether selecting date range quick options works
in NewSearchPageTest.

Use the 'FindBy' annotation to locate some new search
page Web elements.
Update testing Institution Facet.

Add a test to check if new search page is accessible
without any error for low privileged users.

timeline.bodyText: Does it need to depend on any prior test? Seeing it's logging in with a new session, it should be stand-alone really shouldn't it?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.message: Merge branch 'component/new-search-page' into feature/autotests-for-search-page

Update SearchFacets test because of three new facets
generated from new testing items.
Update the classpath of NewSearchPageTest in CI yaml.

Try to use the administrator account to run REST Module
tests: Search and SearchFacets.

Revert "Try to use the administrator account to run REST Module"

This reverts commit 98096c04139353d1e892e17503198c2b5c542579.
Make sure date range quick option is clickable.

Create a new annotation used to specify whether a
test should be skipped in Old UI mode.

Revert "Create a new annotation used to specify whether a"

This reverts commit 9bf8e8cbcda36e7263f4470da0ce5bbc59470aef.

Add a workaround to temporarily pass NewSearchPageTest
in Old UI.
Add a wait for selecting date range quick option.

Add testing code to check why SearchFacets/Search tests
fail on CI.
A couple tweaks for NewSearchPageTest.

Remove the action of selecting date range option
'Today'.
Two tweaks to help NewSearchPageTest pass on CI.
Wait until Owner Select dialog is closed.
Wait until the whole MUI Owner select Dialog is closed.

Testing code to check what UI mode NewSearchPageTest
is running against.

Revert the abstract method of opening ItemSummary
Page to check why this page is incorrectly open.

Revert "Revert the abstract method of opening ItemSummary"

This reverts commit cc97a410146632c770810d61d0647a5fe031b94a.

Take screenshots to check if Summary page is on
New UI mode.
Let 'Facet' Institution run in Old UI by default.
Remove NewSearchPageTest testing code.
Remove AxiosInstance testing code.
Revert changes made on AxiosInstance.ts
